description: Z-code files use a programming language called the Zork Implementation Language (Zork was Infocom's first game). The file extensions use a numerical value for the different Z-machine versions that are used to run them. Examples include the .Z1 , .Z2 , .Z3 , .Z4 , .Z5 , .Z7 , and .Z8 extensions.
NOTE: Along with Z4 and Z7 files, Z6 file extensions are rarely used.
